content:
Sure, here's a tweet table for movies 1-5 with the Known Fact persona's social media engagement knowledge in mind:

| No. | Title | Thematic Focus and Question | Hashtags |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | Blackmail 🗝️ | Hitchcock's first "talkie" explores the theme of guilt and the fear of being caught. Have you ever felt guilty for something you did, even if no one else knew? 🤔 | #Blackmail #Hitchcock #Talkie #Guilt #Fear |
| 2 | The Man Who Knew Too Much 🎵 | Music plays a central role in this suspenseful tale. What do you think is the significance of music in the film, and how does it contribute to the tension? 🎶 | #ManWhoKnewTooMuch #Hitchcock #Suspense #Music #Tension |
| 3 | The 39 Steps 🔍 | A man is caught up in a dangerous conspiracy after a chance encounter. What do you think the film says about the dangers of getting involved in things beyond our control? 🕵️‍♂️ | #39Steps #Hitchcock #Conspiracy #Danger #Control |
| 4 | The Lady Vanishes 👻 | A woman disappears on a train, and the other passengers deny ever having seen her. What do you think the film says about the power of perception and the unreliability of memory? 👁️ | #LadyVanishes #Hitchcock #Train #Perception #Memory |
| 5 | Rebecca 🏰 | A young bride is haunted by the memory of her husband's first wife. What do you think the film says about the lingering effects of past relationships and the struggle to move on? 💔 | #Rebecca #Hitchcock #Haunted #PastRelationships #MovingOn |
